benchmark_details.name: Identifying Banking Transaction Descriptions via Support Vector Machine Based on a Specialized Labelled Corpus
benchmark_details.overview: This paper describes a novel system that combines Natural Language Processing techniques with Machine Learning algorithms to classify banking transaction descriptions for personal finance management.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a simple and efficient short-text classification system for banking transaction descriptions.

data.source: Labelled dataset with real customer transactions from major Spanish banks.
data.annotation: The dataset is labelled with predefined categories for classification.

methods: Text similarity detection using Jaccard distance
methodology.calculation: Macro-averaged metrics were computed based on the number of true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives for each category.
methodology.interpretation: After enabling all features, precision is prioritized followed by recall, especially for financial applications.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared with three competitor approaches with differing results in precision and recall rates.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation was performed with various splits of training and testing subsets.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Permissions were obtained from real users to retrieve data.
